posts.post_content:
I think is was a good idea to make Lord the main-stage card for the deck. Even though nearly everyone will concur that [Reiver Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reiver Demon) is better (not strictly, mind you), it's not a Lord of something, and it hasn't been around since the beginning of the game.   
  
I think many old fans appreciated it. Good job, guys.

posts.post_content:
New artwork is fail, no one who respects this card would play anything but the original art. Still, all sorts of new possibilities for this guy these days. [Reassembling Skeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reassembling Skeleton) is my current favorite. I also play this in my rat deck - my wife hates it.  
  
This is the card that made me want to start playing this game. First, I just love saying "Lord of the Pit." Then there's the artwork... nothing like it, man (on the ORIGINAL, that is). As far as the suicide aspect, dying to this thing because I wasn't able to control it was so flavorful that it was almost ok. I mean, I started playing D&D/AD&D back in 81, so I got that if you summoned a demon and screwed around with it, you'd die. No cacodemon spells here. And when I didn't die, but used my summoned fiend to crush my opponent? All was right with the world.  
  
This card isn't about what is better and what is worse. This card is about, well, this card. And it has to be a 5/5, because this is Magic, and it's a Lord of t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

This is the card that made me want to start playing this game. First, I just love saying "Lord of the Pit." Then there's the artwork... nothing like it, man (on the ORIGINAL, that is). As far as the suicide aspect, dying to this thing because I wasn't able to control it was so flavorful that it was almost ok. And when I didn't die, but used my summoned fiend to crush my opponent? All was right with the world.

Posted By: Ferlord (6/10/2012 3:29:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Gibbler  
  
No, you can only sacrifice your own creatures. If you have no other creatures you are forced to take 7 damage. But if you have other creatures, you are forced to sac one. You can't choose to take 7 damage instead.
posts.html:
@Gibbler

No, you can only sacrifice your own creatures. If you have no other creatures you are forced to take 7 damage. But if you have other creatures, you are forced to sac one. You can't choose to take 7 damage instead.
